title: Suggestion
description: This release is more than 4 months old. Check the website or GitHub to see if there is an update available.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install libpam-tmpdir to set $TMP and $TMPDIR for PAM sessions|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install apt-listbugs to display a list of critical bugs prior to each APT installation.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install apt-listchanges to display any significant changes prior to any upgrade via APT.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install needrestart, alternatively to debian-goodies, so that you can run needrestart after upgrades to determine which daemons are using old versions of libraries and need restarting.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install fail2ban to automatically ban hosts that commit multiple authentication errors.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Set a password on GRUB boot loader to prevent altering boot configuration (e.g. boot in single user mode without password)|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Determine runlevel and services at startup|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Consider hardening system services|Run '/usr/bin/systemd-analyze security SERVICE' for each service|-|

title: Warning
description: Reboot of system is most likely needed||text:reboot|

title: Suggestion
description: Configure password hashing rounds in /etc/login.defs|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install a PAM module for password strength testing like pam_cracklib or pam_passwdqc or libpam-passwdqc|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: When possible set expire dates for all password protected accounts|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Configure minimum password age in /etc/login.defs|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Default umask in /etc/login.defs could not be found and defaults usually to 022, which could be more strict like 027|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: To decrease the impact of a full /home file system, place /home on a separate partition|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Disable drivers like USB storage when not used, to prevent unauthorized storage or data theft|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Disable drivers like firewire storage when not used, to prevent unauthorized storage or data theft|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Check DNS configuration for the dns domain name|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Check RPM database as RPM binary available but does not reveal any packages|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install debsums utility for the verification of packages with known good database.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install package apt-show-versions for patch management purposes|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Consider using a tool to automatically apply upgrades|-|-|

title: Warning
description: Couldn't find 2 responsive nameservers|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Check your resolv.conf file and fill in a backup nameserver if possible|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Determine if protocol 'dccp' is really needed on this system|-|-|

title: Warning
description: iptables module(s) loaded, but no rules active|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install Apache mod_evasive to guard webserver against DoS/brute force attempts|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install Apache modsecurity to guard webserver against web application attacks|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Change the allow_url_fopen line to: allow_url_fopen = Off, to disable downloads via PHP|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Enable logging to an external logging host for archiving purposes and additional protection|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Check what deleted files are still in use and why.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Remove rsh client when it is not in use or replace with the more secure SSH package|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: It is recommended that TFTP be removed, unless there is a specific need for TFTP (such as a boot server)|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Removing the atftpd package decreases the risk of the accidental (or intentional) activation of tftp services|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Add a legal banner to /etc/issue, to warn unauthorized users|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Add legal banner to /etc/issue.net, to warn unauthorized users|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Enable process accounting|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Enable sysstat to collect accounting (disabled)|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Enable auditd to collect audit information|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Install a file integrity tool to monitor changes to critical and sensitive files|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Determine if automation tools are present for system management|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Consider restricting file permissions|See screen output or log file|text:Use chmod to change file permissions|

title: Suggestion
description: Double check the permissions of home directories as some might be not strict enough.|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: One or more sysctl values differ from the scan profile and could be tweaked||Change sysctl value or disable test (skip-test=KRNL-6000:<sysctl-key>)|

title: Suggestion
description: Harden compilers like restricting access to root user only|-|-|

title: Suggestion
description: Harden the system by installing at least one malware scanner, to perform periodic file system scans|-|Install a tool like rkhunter, chkrootkit, OSSEC, Wazuh|
